canvas

Class Canvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • canvas.Canvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Canvas
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Canvas class is the container in which all layers with shapes are in. It is like the coordinate system for the operations which will take place. It manages all layers and shapes. Every object is "registered" in the canvas.
    See Also:
    Shape, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Canvas()
      This is the default constructor of the Canvas class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Canvas

        public Canvas()
        This is the default constructor of the Canvas class. It gets called when the user calls the webpage. We chose a default value of 200x200, but the user can change its actual size all the time when needed.

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        public double getWidth()
        Returns the width of the canvas. Gets called when the canvas gets parsed into json to send it to the client.
        Returns:
        returns width in Double

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(double width)
        Lets you set the width of the canvas. This gets called when the user edits the canvas.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the canvas in Double

      • getHeight

        public double getHeight()
        Returns the height of the canvas. Gets called when the canvas gets parsed into json to send it to the client.
        Returns:
        returns height in Double

      • setHeight

        Parameters:
        height - the height of the canvas in Double

      • getCanvasElements

        public java.util.List<CanvasElement> getCanvasElements()
        Returns a List of the CanvasElement which are in the canvas. This gets called when the canvas gets parsed into json to send it to the client.
        Returns:
        a List of CanvasElement

      • doesAllowTransformAttribute

        public boolean doesAllowTransformAttribute()
        Returns true if the Canvas allows the use of the HTML "transform" attribute for its Shapes.
        Returns:
        true if the Canvas allows the use of the HTML "transform" attribute for its Shapes, false otherwise.

      • setAllowTransformAttribute

        public void setAllowTransformAttribute(boolean allowTransformAttribute)
        Sets whether to allow the use of the HTML "transform" attribute for Shapes on the Canvas. Changing this to false might cause existing transformations to be lost.
        Parameters:
        allowTransformAttribute - Set to true to allow the use of the HTML "transform" attribute for Shapes on the Canvas, false otherwise.

      • getShapeFactory

        public ShapeFactory getShapeFactory()
        Returns the ShapeFactory this Canvas uses to create Shapes.
        Returns:
        The ShapeFactory this Canvas uses to create Shapes.

      • getHTML

        public java.lang.String getHTML()
        Returns the SVG container for the HTML file.
        Returns:
        returns a String which contains the SVG container

        public void addElement(CanvasElement element)
        Adds a new element to the elements of the canvas.
        Parameters:
        element - The element which will get added.

      • addElement

        public void addElement(CanvasElement element,
                       long addBeforeElementID)
        Adds a new element to the elements of the canvas before another element.
        Parameters:
        element - The element which will get added.
        addBeforeElementID - The ID of the element where the new element gets added before.

      • addElementIntoElement

        public void addElementIntoElement(CanvasElement element,
                                  long addIntoElementID)
        Adds an element beneath another element if it's possible. If it's not possible it throws an IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        element - Element which should get nested.
        addIntoElementID - The ID of the element where the other element should get added.

        Parameters:

        Parameters:

      • addGroupLayer

      • addGroupLayer

        public void addGroupLayer(long addBeforeElementID)
        Adds a new group layer to the canvas before the elementID in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        addBeforeElementID - The ID of the element where the new layerGroup should get added.

      • addGroupLayerIntoElement

        public void addGroupLayerIntoElement(long addIntoElementID)
        Adds a layerGroup beneath another element if it's possible. If it's not possible it throws an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        addIntoElementID - The ID of the element where the other element should get added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If an element with the specified ID does not exist or if the element to add into is not a CanvasElementAggregate.

        Returns:
        The CanvasElement with the given ID.
